newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's Endesa buys 90 pct of Argentine station.
newsitem.headline: Spain's Endesa buys 90 pct of Argentine station.

text.p: Spanish electricity firm Endesa said it would buy 90 percent of the Dock Sud thermal power station in Argentina and expand it with a total investment of 330 million dollars over four years.

To finance the project, Endesa said it had created a new firm called Inversora Dock Sud together with Argentine oil group Astra, 32-percent owned by Spain's Repsol. Endesa has a 76.2 percent stake in the new firm and Astra 23.8 percent.
Argentina's Bridas has agreed to supply gas for the project for 15 years, Endesa said in a statement.
